description.narrative: Sveriges strategi för utvecklingssamarbete med Etiopien berör områdena demokrati, mänskliga rättigheter och jämställdhet, där fokus ligger på rättsatsprincipen, ansvarsskyldighet, insyn, stöd till civilsamhället samt sexuell och reproduktiv hälsa och rättigheter. Insatsen syftar till att stödja den reform som genomförts av rättsväsendet, det vill säga den federala högsta domstolen i Etiopien. Ett välfungerande rättsväsende är avgörande för att mänskliga rättigheter ska kunna realiseras, för att bygga ett samhälle baserat på rättvisa och rättsstatsprincipen, samt för att säkerställa ansvarsskyldighet och öppenhet. Där med är stödet i linje med de viktigaste prioriteringarna i det svenska utvecklingssamarbetet. Det erinras om att detta ingripande är ett 18 månaders ingripande vilket kommer att fungera som en byggsten för den övergripande reformen av justitiesektorn. Syftet med detta ingripande är att utnyttja reformens fart samt att arbeta med snabba vinst-aktiviteter för att skapa förtroende genom att visa upp resultat och förbättringar. Insatsen syftar också till att utforma reformer av rättssektorns strategier och institutionsspecifika handlingsplaner. Sidas avtalspartner för förevarande intervention är UNDP. Den genomförande partnern kommer att vara den federala högsta domstolen i Etiopien. UNDP bedöms ha tillräcklig kapacitet och kompetens för att genomföra, följa upp och rapportera om programmet. Det är här värt att nämna att ambassaden har ett pågående avtal med UNDP om ett bidrag som kallas Governance and Democratic Participation Program (GDPP). En grundlig utvärderingsprocess har genomförts på UNDP 2017, före stödet till BNP. Hittills finns det inget som tyder på att UNDP inte presterar som avsett, trots den svåra arbetsmiljön.

This is an intervention to support the Federal Supreme Court of Ethiopia in its efforts to reform the judiciary at the federal level. The judicial reform is part of a comprehensive justice sector reform that Ethiopia is attempting to carry out. The current intervention, which is part of a 3 years reform project designed by the Federal Supreme Court, will have a duration of 18 months and a total budget of 11,000,000 SEK. The intervention will focus on selected quick win activities that will help kick start the reform process and help seize a political momentum. It will also have a component of supporting the ongoing task of designing a comprehensive justice sector reform, by a steering committee (composed of the relevant law enforcement organs) that is chaired by the President of the Supreme Court.
Sweden is keen to support the reform of the justice sector in Ethiopia as it is an important result area in its current development cooperation strategy with Ethiopia.
UNDP will be the agreement partner for Sweden and the Federal Supreme Court will be the implementing partner in this intervention. UNDP is the lead multi-lateral organization engaged in the support of the ongoing reform process in Ethiopia. It has a very good working relationship with the government at various levels. It has a very good understanding of the context and easy access to information and to key government officials. In addition, UNDP's strategic plan, as indicated in the central assessment and in the capacity assessment of the partner (below), has six signature solutions that are in line to multi-dimensional poverty reduction.

This short term intervention aims at supporting the ongoing efforts by the government of reforming the judiciary with the aim of enabling it to fulfill its constitutional mandate and strengthen its independence. It will have a paticular focus on designing justice sector reform strategies and institution-specific action plans, that will serve as baseline document for a comprhensive justice sector reform. Moreover, the intervention will also support quick-win initiatives that would start showcasing results and improvements, with the aim of seizing the political momentum and gaining public trust on the reform agenda.

tag.narrative: 16.2 - Eliminera övergrepp, utnyttjande, människohandel och alla former av våld eller tortyr mot barn.
16.2 - End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

description.narrative: The current Support to the Judicial Reform project is a continuation of the Project Initiation Plan, PIP started in 2019. During the reported period, the results achieved under the various objectives can be summarized as follows: - Objective 1 - A legal research support was rendered to the Judicial Affairs Advisory Council and the Federal Supreme Court. Several important research, studies and briefs were produced that helped in bringing about necessary proclamations that promotes the Reform agenda of the Judicial sector. Moreover, the Federal First Instance and Federal High Courts have been successful in reducing the backlogs by almost 53%. The Judicial Reform Project Office has been successfully set up and has been operational during the stated period. The project office is housed within the Federal Supreme Court and has been staffed adequately. - Objective 2 - Efforts have been exerted to increase public legal literacy and awareness about the judiciary and the reform work through television programs. An MoU has been signed between the Federal Supreme Court and Ministry of Education, Addis Ababa Univesity as well as with Ministry of Science and Higher Education to establish justice clubs and court-student dialogue during the academic year. As part of efforts to reach the public with reliable information, the project has deployed communication specialists at the Federal High and First Instance courts to conduct their public relations' efforts. -Objective 3 - As part the promotion of alternative dispute resolution mechanisms, the establishment and strengthening of the Court Annexed Mediation, CAM, has yielded positive effects. The pilot initiative to test CAM, at the Federal Courts on selected family and labour cases has helped in reducing the cases coming to the federal courts.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
